channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Babies take a lesson from soldiers in the war against malaria
item.description: Inspired by a military strategy to ward off disease-carrying mosquitoes, researchers see if the technique will help cut malaria infections in little ones.
item.content:encoded:
Inspired by a military strategy to ward off disease-carrying mosquitoes, researchers see if the technique will help cut malaria infections in little ones.

(Image credit: Jeffrey Davis/Tetra images RF)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: War in Gaza moves into its third year. And, Trump's power to deploy the National Guard
item.description: The Israel-Gaza war moves into its third year today. And, examining President Trump's power to deploy the National Guard.
item.content:encoded:
The Israel-Gaza war moves into its third year today. And, examining President Trump's power to deploy the National Guard.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Illinois AG responds to Trump's push to send National Guard to Chicago
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul about President Trump's efforts to deploy National Guard forces to Chicago, over state and local objections.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul about President Trump's efforts to deploy National Guard forces to Chicago, over state and local objections.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: The Nobel Prize for physics is awarded for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
item.description: The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."
item.content:encoded:
The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."

(Image credit: Christine Olsson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With U.S. leadership in doubt, can its allies chart their own course?
item.description: U.S. allies in Europe and the Indo-Pacific are showing willingness to coordinate and cooperate across a wide range of shared interests, from trade to defense and alliance management to China.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. allies in Europe and the Indo-Pacific are showing willingness to coordinate and cooperate across a wide range of shared interests, from trade to defense and alliance management to China.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ben Bland

item.title: Why Democrats are casting the government shutdown as a health care showdown
item.description: Democrats are pressuring Republicans to extend billions of dollars in federal tax credits that have dramatically lowered premiums and contributed to record-low rates of uninsured Americans.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats are pressuring Republicans to extend billions of dollars in federal tax credits that have dramatically lowered premiums and contributed to record-low rates of uninsured Americans.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Amanda Seitz

item.title: The government has long researched high school experiences. Then DOGE cut the effort
item.description: The federal government has long surveyed high schoolers to help track how their academic choices may have influenced the course of their lives. The Trump administration put an end to that effort.
item.content:encoded: The federal government has long surveyed high schoolers to help track how their academic choices may have influenced the course of their lives. The Trump administration put an end to that effort.
item.dc:creator: Carmela Guaglianone

item.title: A tribe in Arizona planned to connect 600 homes to electricity. Then the funding was cut
item.description: The Hopi Tribe received a multimillion-dollar federal grant to install solar panels and battery storage systems for hundreds of homes. But the Trump administration has canceled the funding.
item.content:encoded:
The Hopi Tribe received a multimillion-dollar federal grant to install solar panels and battery storage systems for hundreds of homes. But the Trump administration has canceled the funding.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Nate Perez

item.title: Bondi set to give testimony to Congress at first hearing since Comey indictment
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi is set to testify before a Senate panel Tuesday amid mounting concerns that the DOJ under her leadership is being weaponized to go after President Trump's perceived enemies.
item.content:encoded:
Attorney General Pam Bondi is set to testify before a Senate panel Tuesday amid mounting concerns that the DOJ under her leadership is being weaponized to go after President Trump's perceived enemies.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Why some federal workers aren't scared by the threat of shutdown layoffs
item.description: Some federal workers support the government shutdown, even as President Trump threatens to use this moment to lay off employees and cut funding to programs.
item.content:encoded:
Some federal workers support the government shutdown, even as President Trump threatens to use this moment to lay off employees and cut funding to programs.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu
